ISSUE.TITLE: userns="keep-id" in ~/.config/containers/containers.conf gets ignored
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ### Issue Description I'm doing exactly as described in the [article](https://www.redhat.com/sysadmin/rootless-podman-user-namespace-modes#:~:text=Change%20the%20default%20user%20namespace%20mode) and the volumes in containers I create are still owned by 0:0. `--userns=keep-id` works. `export PODMAN_USERNS=keep-id` works. Adding `userns = "keep-id"` under `[containers]` in `~/.config/containers/containers.conf` doesn't work. https://github.com/containers/common/blob/main/docs/containers.conf.5.md mentions valid values for userns are `host` and `private`. Using private there has the same effect. ### Steps to reproduce the issue Steps to reproduce the issue 1. Modify `~/.config/containers/containers.conf` so it's like ``` [containers] userns = "keep-id" ``` 2. `podman run -it --rm -v $PWD:/volume alpine ls -l /volume` ### Describe the results you received Files in `/volume` are owned by 0:0. ### Describe the results you expected Files in `/volume` owned by $UID. ### podman info output ```yaml host: arch: amd64 buildahVersion: 1.30.0 cgroupControllers: -
